title: The Scot trekking across Canada to help restore Highland forests
description: Michael Yellowlees and his Alaskan husky Luna spent nine months travelling coast-to-coast on foot.

title: Ros Atkins on... the No 10 Christmas party denials
description: Watch as Ros Atkins investigates the gap between government assurances and available evidence.

title: Hollywood legend Mel Brooks' autobiography published
description: Hollywood legend Mel Brooks discusses love, life and bad taste as his autobiography is published.

title: Omicron: Why is Nigeria on the travel red list?
description: The UK has placed travel restrictions on arrivals from Nigeria and several other African countries - are they fair?

title: Joey Barton cleared of assaulting Daniel Stendel in stadium tunnel
description: The ex-England player is found not guilty of assaulting Barnsley boss Daniel Stendel after a defeat.

title: Tommy Fury v Jake Paul: Fight expected to be called off with Briton struggling for fitness
description: Tommy Fury's fight with Youtuber Jake Paul is expected to be called off with the Briton struggling to be fit.

title: Jude Bellingham: German FA investigating Borussia Dortmund and England midfielder's comments about referee
description: The German Football Association (DFB) are investigating England midfielder Jude Bellingham's comments about referee Felix Zwayer after Borussia Dortmund's defeat by Bayern Munich.

title: Union loses legal challenge to PM's decision to back Priti Patel
description: Boris Johnson kept his home secretary in place, saying she had not broken ministerial rules.

title: The Ashes: Ben Stokes' 'extraordinary' Headingley innings for England against Australia
description: BBC Sport looks back at Ben Stokes' match-winning innings at Headingley during the 2019 Ashes, which Sir Alastair Cook described as "the greatest innings ever played by an Englishman".

title: Covid: UK red list criticised as 'travel apartheid' by Nigeria
description: Nigeria - which was added to the red list on Monday - describes the restrictions as "selective".

title: Drug strategy to tackle 300,000 problem users, says PM
description: A new drug strategy will mean more funding for treatment and a crackdown on gangs, ministers say.

title: Yasmin Evans to leave BBC Radio 1Xtra on Christmas Eve
description: The 1Xtra DJ will be leaving after nine years at the network.

title: Michael Sheen turns himself into a 'not-for-profit' actor
description: The activist pledges to use his money from acting to fund more good causes and charity events.

title: Joni Mitchell and Bette Midler pick up Kennedy Center Honors
description: The legendary Canadian singer makes a rare public appearance at a ceremony hosted by Joe Biden.

title: Gough named Yorkshire cricket managing director
description: Former England fast bowler Darren Gough is appointed as Yorkshire's interim managing director of cricket until the end of the 2022 season.

title: Aung San Suu Kyi: Myanmar court sentences ousted leader to four years jail
description: This is the first verdict delivered for the ex-leader of Myanmar, who faces a total of 11 charges.

title: Pakistan: Killing of Sri Lankan accused of blasphemy sparks protests
description: More than 100 have been arrested over the lynching of a Sri Lankan man accused of insulting Islam.

title: Zambia crocodile attack: 'I was very lucky', says Amelie Osborn-Smith
description: Amelie Osborn-Smith says her brain went into "overdrive" as she fought off the reptile in Zambia.

title: Sports Personality of the Year: Voting open for BBC World Sport Star 2021 award
description: Pick from a shortlist of six for this year's BBC World Sport Star of the Year award.

title: Matt Hancock: Breaking Covid guidance 'failure of leadership'
description: The former health secretary Matt Hancock tells the BBC he is "sorry for all the people I let down".

title: NI 100: Signing of Anglo-Irish Treaty marked 100 years on
description: The treaty created an independent Irish Free State but led to the Irish Civil War.

title: Vladimir Putin: What Russian president's India visit means for world politics
description: Russia and India ties are facing challenges from fast-changing geopolitics in Asia and beyond.

title: Next pandemic could be more lethal, says jab creator
description: More funding is needed to prepare for pandemics and prevent gains from being lost, Dame Sarah Gilbert says.

title: Covid in Uganda: The man whose children may never return to school
description: The 20-month school closure in Uganda could have a long-term impact on many lives there.

title: Care homes: Following the money trail
description: BBC Panorama unpicks the financial webs behind leading companies, as families ask where their fees go.

title: Climate change: Is ‘blue hydrogen’ Japan’s answer to coal?
description: The Fukushima disaster turned Japan away from nuclear. A new energy source may help it quit coal.

title: Thomas Massie: US congressman condemned for Christmas guns photo
description: The photo of Thomas Massie's family posing with firearms was posted days after a deadly school shooting.

title: The tech helping shops - and Santa - deliver this Christmas
description: A number of tech solutions are out there to help retailers optimise sending out our presents.

title: James Webb Space Telescope scientist: 'It's the future of astrophysics'
description: The James Webb Space Telescope is expected to be 100 times more powerful than the Hubble.

title: How Lebanon's economic problems could leave Sara blind
description: Lebanon stopped has stopped subsidising many medical expenses, which leaves poorer patients in danger.

title: The Palestinian jailbreak that rocked Israel
description: The search for six Palestinian fugitives from an Israeli prison unearths a story of dispossession, violence and bitter division in a fractured region.

title: Wet Leg, Pink Pantheress and Central Cee make BBC Sound of 2022 list
description: They're among 10 acts tipped for success in the annual BBC list, previously won by Adele and Celeste.
